resources.string: You can keep casting when the screen of your device is turned off. This feature decreases power consumption.
"Don't display floating notifications, incoming calls, and other private items on external monitors"
"Minimize the window that's being cast to be able to use other features of your phone"
Authorize casting on your TV first
"Couldn't authorize casting on your TV. Wait a minute or two and try again."
Turn on Wi-Fi to be able to cast using NFC. Turn on now?
"Make sure that the wireless casting feature is turned on on the target device. View help if you have problems connecting."
Turn on Wi-Fi and Bluetooth on your phone to use Wireless Display.
Keep casting when the screen of your device is turned off. This feature decreases power consumption. Press the Power button to turn the screen back on.
About to cast with screen off…
"Casting is projecting the items from your phone's screen on a bigger external monitor. It allows you to share images and videos with your friends and family without using mobile data."
How do I cast items on a bigger screen?
Step 1: Check your devices and network environment

"1. You don't need to connect to the internet if you want to cast something from a Mi phone to a Mi TV. 2. If you can't establish connection between the two devices, try connecting both of them to the same Wi-Fi network."

"1. Mi TVs, Mi Boxes, and Mi Projectors: Connect both your phone and external monitor to the same Wi-Fi network for best effect. If they are connected to different networks, it might take more time to find the external monitor and connect. Note: Older Mi TVs might not support casting across different networks. 2. If you're using TVs, set-top boxes, or projectors of other brands, connect both your phone and external monitor to the same Wi-Fi network. If the two devices can't be connected to the same network, turn on Miracast on your external monitor. The naming of Miracast functionality might vary."
"Tap the \"Cast\" toggle on your phone's Notification shade. Turn on both Wi-Fi and Bluetooth for a more stable connection."
If you want to cast items from Gallery or Mi Video, you can use built-in casting features in these apps.
Select an external device from the list of the available devices to start casting.

"1. If you want to use a Xiaomi device, but can't find it in the list of available devices, try the following: Connect both your phone and the external monitor (e.g. your TV) to the same Wi-Fi network, or connect the external monitor to your phone's hotspot. If there aren't any Wi-Fi networks available or you can't connect both devices to the same network, check whether the casting features on your external monitor are up to date, turn on Bluetooth both on your phone and the external monitor, and turn on Miracast on your TV. 2. If you're casting on a Xiaomi device for the first time, you need to complete verification. 3. If you want to use a non-Xiaomi device, but can't find it in the list of available devices, try the following: Connect both your phone and the external monitor (e.g. your TV) to the same Wi-Fi network, or connect the external monitor to your phone's hotspot. If this doesn't help, install the LeEco casting app on your TV and follow the instructions."

"1. If you want to use a Xiaomi device, but can't find it in the list of available devices, try the following: Connect both your phone and the external monitor (e.g. your TV) to the same Wi-Fi network, or connect the external monitor to your phone's hotspot. If there aren't any Wi-Fi networks available or you can't connect both devices to the same network, check whether the casting features on your external monitor are up to date, turn on Bluetooth both on your phone and the external monitor, and turn on Miracast on your TV. 2. If you're casting on a Xiaomi device for the first time, you need to complete verification. 3. If you want to use a non-Xiaomi device, but can't find it in the list of available devices, try the following: Connect both your phone and the external monitor (e.g. your TV) to the same Wi-Fi network, or connect the external monitor to your phone's hotspot."

"You can project items from your Mi phone on most Mi TV models with Bluetooth capabilities without turning on Miracast manually. If you need to turn on Miracast, press the [MENU] button and select My apps > Casting > Miracast."

First, make sure that Miracast functionality is supported on your device. On some of the models, you can press the [SOURCE] button on the remote control and then select \"Screen Mirroring\". This feature is turned on by default on various models.
First, make sure that Miracast functionality is supported on your device. This feature is turned on by default on various models.
First, make sure that Miracast functionality is supported on your device. This feature is turned on by default on various models.

First, make sure that Miracast functionality is supported on your device. On some of the models, you can press the [MENU] button on the remote control and then select Settings > Connection > Network > Multiple screens.

First, make sure that Miracast functionality is supported on your device. On some of the models, you can press the [SMART] button on the remote control and then select Casting > Wireless Display. Some models also support casting for games: Hi Cast > Cast games > Android.
First, make sure that Miracast functionality is supported on your device. On some of the models, you can select Apps > Casting > Android device > Miracast.

First, make sure that Miracast functionality is supported on your device. On some of the models, you can press the [SOURCE] button on the remote control and then select \"Screen Mirroring\". On some other models, you can turn this feature on in Networks > Wi-Fi Direct. This feature is turned on by default on various models.
First, make sure that Miracast functionality is supported on your device. On some of the models, you can select Apps > Screen Mirroring.
Check the settings of your TV to make sure that your external monitor supports Miracast functionality.
First, make sure that Miracast functionality is supported on your device. On some of the models, you can select Apps > Wireless Display.
First, make sure that Miracast functionality is supported on your device. To turn this feature on, go to My Apps > WiFi Display.
First, make sure that Miracast functionality is supported on your device. On some of the models, you can turn this feature on in Settings > Networks > Multiple screens > Wireless Display.

"If you can't connect to the network, make sure your external monitor supports Miracast functionality and it's turned on. On some models, this feature is called Wireless Display, Screen Mirroring, or Multiple screens. View the information below to learn how to turn on Miracast. 4. If you encounter any issues, you can report them using our \"Services & feedback\" app."

"If you can't connect to the network, make sure your external monitor supports Miracast functionality and it's turned on. On some models, this feature is called Wireless Display, Screen Mirroring, or Multiple screens. 4. If you encounter any issues, you can report them using our \"Services & feedback\" app."
"If the brand of your device isn't listed here, contact the manufacturer to learn more about casting functionality."
欢迎使用投屏，您可使用本应用将手机画面实时同步至电视/电视盒子/投影等大屏设备。在使用本应用的过程中，我们将联网并向您申请以下权限：
使用蓝牙扫描附近可投屏的设备
获取附近可投屏的设备信息
用于该应用的基本服务与功能
使用NFC关联您要投屏的设备
用于附加功能，将在您使用相关功能时向您申请
使用WLAN扫描附近可投屏的设备

<Data>"Welcome to Casting! Casting allows projecting the items from your phone's screen on a bigger external monitor. We shall protect your personal information in accordance with the relevant laws, regulations, and privacy policies. Some features are provided by a third party service provider HappyCast. Before using this feature, read and agree to <a href=%2$s>HappyCast Legal Statement</a> and <a href=%1$s>HappyCast Privacy Policy</a>. To be able to work normally, this app needs to connect to the internet and requires the following permissions in order to collect your personal information:"</Data>

<Data>"If you don't agree to grant such permissions or share and upload your personal information, you won't be able to use this app. You can choose to uninstall this app, sign out, or restrict permissions in the Settings in such cases. Read and agree to our <a href=%1$s>User Agreement</a> and <a href=%2$s>Privacy Policy</a> before using this feature."</Data>

" •Access and save images on your device in order to project these items on external monitors •Record calls and audio in order to cast audio on external devices •Access phone number, IMEI, and IMSI to identify your device •Access your location to find devices nearby"
Turn on wireless casting on the target device
Searching for devices might take some time…
"External devices are easier to find when they're connected to the same network as your phone"
"Can't minimize this app while it's being cast"
Tap to view more casting features
"Can't use this feature with Split screen"
"You can minimize the window that's being cast to be able to use other features of your phone without interrupting the casting process."
Turn off portable hotspot before casting
